lead_paragraph: Plans to redevelop the former site of the Colored Orphan Asylum, which a mob burned down in the 1863 draft riots, present an opportunity to examine the lot for some tangible remnant of the asylum.

headline.print_headline: ­A Vile Civil War Act, on Fifth Avenue
headline.main: Remembering a Vile Civil War Act, on Fifth Avenue

snippet: Plans to redevelop the former site of the Colored Orphan Asylum, which a mob burned down in the 1863 draft riots, present an opportunity to examine the lot for some tangible remnant of the asylum.
abstract: David W Dunlap Building Blocks column holds plan by developer Louis Ceruzzi to build on lot where colored Orphan Asylum once stood on Fifth Avenue in Midtown Manhattan offers opportunity for preservationists to search for archaeological remnants that may shed light on lives of its 200 occupants; asylum was sacked by murderous mob during draft riots in July 1863, one of more shameful moments in New York City history.
